html: In the millennial age of peace that follows the mission of Jehovah’s servant, promised lands—a second chief covenant blessing after offspring—transform into a new Paradise ( Isaiah 11:1-9; 55:4-13; 65:17-25). Ruins are rebuilt by Jehovah’s elect in Zion who receive inheritances of land ( Isaiah 44:26; 58:11-12; 61:4). To those who heed thevoice of Jehovah’s servant ( Isaiah 28:23; 50:10; 58:1), whose righteousness resembles hisrighteousness ( v 1), all attests to covenant curses—ruins, wilderness, and desert—joyously reversing into covenant blessings ( Isaiah 32:15-20; 35:1-2, 6-7; 58:12).
